recipe.title: Toasted Pumpkin Seed and Chile Dip (Pipián)
recipe.description:
Toasted over a traditional 'comal' or in a dry frying pan until they pop, the seeds are then ground up and used to add an earthy, nutty flavour.
Unlike many Mexican dishes which are unapologetically time consuming, this is fairly straightforward and quick to make. In Susana's kitchen we had this on tostadas but it would make a great dip for vegetables, bread or used as a sandwich spread with grilled halloumi. This would make a tasty and interesting change from the jars of hummous that many of us keep in our fridges.
recipe.directions: > dry roast pumpkin seeds on medium heat until puffed up and golden, about 5m peel tomatoes puré with jalapeños chilies until smooth remove from stove, discard garlic, chop coarsely and set aside sauté onion in olive oil on medium heat until translucent, about 5m add garlic for 1m add tomato and chilies pureé and simmer until thickened, about 6-8m season with salt and pepper and let cool blend pumpkin seeds until powder mix with tomato puré, water if needed and coriander leaves >
